scoop bucket list: Lists the buckets that have been added
scoop bucket add:
Command: scoop bucket add <bucket_name> <bucket_url>
Add Scoop bucket
eg: scoop bucket add extras
scoop bucket rm:
Command: scoop bucket rm <bucket_name>
Remove Scoop bucket
eg : scoop bucket rm extras
scoop search:
Command: scoop search <app>
Search available apps
eg: scoop search main\sudo
scoop install:
Command: scoop install [-g|-u|-k|-i|-s|-a] <app>
Install apps
eg : scoop install -u main\sudo
scoop install -u:
Alias: --no-update-scoop
Don't update Scoop before installing if it's outdated
scoop install -k:
Alias: --no-cache
Don't use the download cache
scoop install -s:
Alias: --skip
Skip hash validation (use with caution!)
scoop install -a:
Alias: --arch <32bit|64bit|arm64>
Use the specified architecture <32bit|64bit|arm64>, if the app supports it
scoop uninstall:
Command: scoop uninstall [-g|-p] <app>
Uninstall apps
eg : scoop uninstall sudo
scoop update:
Command: scoop update [-f|-g|-i|-k|-s|-q|-a] <app>
Update apps, or Scoop itself
eg : scoop update 7zip
scoop update -f:
Alias: --force
Force update even when there isn't a newer version
scoop update -g:
Alias: --global
Update a globally installed app
scoop update -k:
Alias: --no-cache
Don't use the download cache
scoop update -s:
Alias: --skip
Skip hash validation (use with caution!)
scoop list:
List installed apps
scoop list [pattern]
eg : scoop list 7  -- List all installed apps with names of 7
scoop info:
Command: scoop info [--verbose] <app>
Display information about an app
eg : scoop info 7zip
scoop cache:
Command: scoop cache <show|rm> <app>
Show or clear the download cache
eg : scoop cache <show/rm> <app>
scoop cache show:
See what's in the cache
eg : scoop cache show *
     scoop cache show 7zip
scoop cache rm:
Remove the cache of app
eg : scoop cache rm *
     scoop cache rm 7zip
scoop reset:
Reset an app to resolve conflicts
eg : scoop reset python
     scoop reset python27
scoop cleanup:
Command: scoop cleanup [-a|-g|-k|-h] <app|*>
Cleanup apps by removing old versions
eg : scoop cleanup 7zip
scoop cleanup -g:
Alias: --global
Cleanup a globally installed app
scoop prefix:
Returns the path to the specified app
eg : scoop prefix 7zip
scoop cat:
Show content of specified manifest
eg : scoop cat 7zip
scoop checkup: Check for potential problems with Scoop
scoop alias:
Manage scoop aliases
eg : scoop alias add <alias_name> <command> <description>
     scoop alias rm <alias_name>
     scoop alias list
scoop alias add:
Command: scoop alias add <alias_name> <command> <description>
Add an Alias
eg : scoop alias add upgrade 'scoop update * Updates all apps'
     Then type 'scoop upgrade' to run 'scoop update *
scoop alias rm:
Command: scoop alias rm <alias_name>
Remove an Alias
eg : scoop alias rm upgrade
scoop shim:
Command: scoop shim [-g] <add/rm/list/info/alter> <shim_name>...
Manipulate Scoop shims
scoop shim add:
Command: scoop shim add <shim_name> <command_path> [<args>...]
Add a custom shim
scoop shim rm:
Command: scoop shim rm <shim_name> [<shim_name>...]
Remove shims(This could remove shims added by an app manifest)
scoop shim list:
Command: scoop shim list [<shim_name>|<pattern>...]
List all shims or matching shims
scoop shim info:
Command: scoop shim info <shim_name>
Show a shim's information
scoop shim alter:
Command: scoop shim alter <shim_name>
Alternate a shim's target source
scoop config:
Command: scoop config <key> [value]
Get or set configuration values
scoop which:
Locate a shim/executable (similar to 'which' on Linux)
eg : scoop which sudo
scoop hold:
Command: scoop hold [-g] <app>
Hold an app to disable updates
eg : scoop hold <app>
scoop hold -g:
Command: scoop hold [-g] <app>
Hold an global app to disable updates
eg : scoop hold -g <app>
scoop unhold:
Command: scoop unhold [-g] <app>
Unhold an app to disable updates
eg : scoop unhold <app>
scoop unhold -g:
Command: scoop unhold [-g] <app>
Unhold an global app to disable updates
eg : scoop unhold -g <app>
scoop export:
Command: scoop export [-c]
Exports installed apps, buckets (and optionally configs) in JSON format
eg : scoop export -c > ~\Desktop\scoopfile.json
 and you can see it in your Desktop
scoop export -c:
Alias: --config
Export the Scoop configuration file too
scoop import:
Imports apps, buckets and configs from a Scoopfile in JSON format
eg : scoop import ~\Desktop\scoopfile.json
 scoop import <url to scoopfile.json>
scoop depends:
Command: scoop depends <app>
List dependencies for an app, in the order they'll be installed
eg : scoop depends python
scoop status:
Show status and check for new app versions
eg : scoop status -l
scoop status -l:
Alias: --local
Checks the status for only the locally installed apps,and disables remote fetching/checking for Scoop and buckets
scoop create:
Create a custom app manifest
eg : scoop create <app_url>
scoop download:
Download apps in the cache folder and verify hashes
eg : 
The usual way to download an app, without installing it:
 scoop download git
To download a different version of the app:
 scoop download gh@2.7.0
To download an app from a manifest at a URL:
 scoop download https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ScoopInstaller/Main/master/bucket/sudo.json
To download an app from a manifest on your computer:
 scoop download path\to\app.json
scoop download -u:
Alias: --no-update-scoop
Don't update Scoop before downloading if it's outdated
scoop download -a:
Alias: --arch <32bit|64bit|arm64>
Use the specified architecture, if the app supports it
scoop virustotal:
Command: scoop virustotal [* | app1 app2 ...] [options]
Look for app's hash or url on virustotal.com
scoop virustotal -a:
Alias: --all
Check for all installed apps
scoop virustotal -u:
Alias: --no-update-scoop
Don't update Scoop before checking if it's outdated
scoop virustotal -s:
Alias: --scan
For packages where VirusTotal has no information, send download URL for analysis (and future retrieval). 
This requires you to configure your virustotal_api_key.
scoop virustotal -n:
Alias: --no-depends
By default, all dependencies are checked too. This flag avoids it.
scoop home:
Command: scoop home <app>
Opens the app homepage
eg: scoop home sudo
scoop -v:
Alias: --version
Print the current version of scoop
scoop setup: Enable scoop for the current user / shell
scoop completions:
Generate scoop completions
You already have scoop-tab-completion. You don't need it
